Methods: A PICO was formulated, and the keyword: (Triclosancoated sutures OR TCS) AND (surgical-site infection OR SSI) AND preventi* was used to search ClinicalKey, Cochrane Library and PubMed databases for literatures published in 3 years. In PubMed we filtered 5 relevant systematic review (SR). One 2017 published SR was selected in which Trial sequential analysis (TSA) was employed to assess the risk of random error, and quality of evidence was determined using Grading of Recommendations Assessment, Development and Evaluation (GRADE) methodology for appraisal (i.e., to assess validity, importance, and applicability of this systematically analyzed evidence). Results: The SR involves 21 RCTs, 6462 patients. Pooled effects showed a RR of 0⋅72 (95%CI 0.60-0.86; P < 0⋅001). At a risk of 138 SSIs per 1000 procedures, the use of TCS reduced this by 39 (95%CI 19-55) and a Number Needed to Treat (NNT) of 25. The SR also performed subgroup analysis and meta-regression to explore the source of heterogeneity. In subgroup analysis of polydioxanone and CDC wound classification there was no significant effect on the prevention of SSI. TABREF170.text: 470 Bloodstream infection in heart transplant recipients: 8-year experience in medical center Ching Ching Chang 1 , Yin-Yin Chen 2 , Fu-Der Wang 3 *. 1 Infection Control, Taipei Veterans General Hospital, 2 National Yang-Ming University, 3 Medical Department, Taipei Veterans General Hospital Background: Bloodstream infection (BSI) is a well-recognized problem and it affects 10-50% of solid organ transplant recipients. The purpose of this study was to assess the incidence and prognosis of BSI in heart transplant recipients at our hospital. Methods: The study is a retrospective chart review. We studied 39 consecutive HT performed at our institution between 2008 and 2014. Results: We diagnosed 19 episodes of BSI in 15 out of 39 heart transplant patients (38.5%) during the 8-year study period. BSI occurred at a median of 44 days (range 5-1998) after transplant and 78.9% occurred within 6 months after transplant. Most BSI episodes were occurring within 2-6 months (47.8%) transplant and. Through the observation and audit on the clinical practice of care procedures for endotracehal tube, we found several steps against the evidenced based care bundle. First, the head of the bed was not reached 30-45°; Second, the concentration of chlorhexidine for oral hygiene care was lower than the recommend level of at least 0.12%; Third, the compliance of daily sedation vacations and assessment of readiness to extubate were also not adequate. The overall correctness was only 49.4%. Once the patient developing ventilator associated pneumonia, the length of stay, antibiotics consumption and medical costs will increase and may cause patient mortality. Methods: (1) Make a marker for indicating 30°of the head of the bed.(2)Hold the educational course for the oral hygiene care.(3)Establish the standard operating procedure for daily sedation vacation. (4) Implement the computer information system to remind the compliance. (5) Make a daily assessment board for invasive medical procedures. (6) Tape a educational video for preventing ventilator associated pneumonia.(7)Introduce scenario simulation teaching. (8) Apply "team resource management" and interdisciplinary model to remind the daily assessment for readiness to extubate. Results: We started the improvement measures since March 2016. The correctness and compliance of bundle intervention for ventilator associated pneumonia were 100% during April and September, 2016. The additional benefit was the ventilator associated pneumonia rate was 0.21‰ during January and September, 2016. There was only one episode of ventilator associated pneumonia. Conclusion: Through the interdisciplinary cooperation, effective communications, brain storming, we introduced creative intervention on care bundle for ventilator associated pneumonia which can improve the correctness and compliance of bundle intervention for ventilator associated pneumonia in intensive care unit and also can reduce the incidence of ventilator associated pneumonia. Results: From 2002 to 2012, we identified 1.26 million patients hospitalized with sepsis, and 1.36 million episodes of infections. In general, all sources of infection showed an increased in incidence over the past 11 years: musculoskeletal infection (127%), genitourinary tract infection (35%), lower respiratory tract infection (31%), skin and appendix structure infection (31%), intra-abdominal infection (23%), and systematic fungal infection (22%). However, the incidence of biliary tract infection remained relatively unchanged. Lower respiratory tract infection (mean mortality rate: 25.3%) and intra-abdominal infection (mean mortality rate: 25.1%) were consistently associated with poorer sepsis outcome than other five sources of infection. Other types of infections, genitourinary tract infection, biliary tract, musculoskeletal, skin and skin structure, and systematic fungal infection, had relatively favorable outcome (mean mortality rate: 15.1%, 13.6%, 11.9%, 13.4%, and 11.8%, respectively). All sources of infection followed a decreasing trend of mortality in the 11-year period, with biliary tract infection experiencing the largest decline of mortality (34.6%) over time.Conclusion: The incidence of infections among Taiwanese sepsis patients is increasing, and is associated with high mortality. The substantial increase in incidence of musculoskeletal infection warrants further attention.

Background: Penile ulcers are usually linked to STDs; however, atypical infections such as scrub typhus should also be considered. Methods: This is a 21-year-old man who was a part-time worker on Daylily mountain. He was admitted for intermittent fevers to 40°C for one week. The patient was doing well until one week prior to admission when he started to have intermittent fevers accompanied by headache and abdominal pain. Also, there is a painless ulcer at glans penis ( Figure 1 ) along with bilateral inguinal lymphadenopathy. Four days prior to admission, non-pruritic papular skin rashes spread from face to trunk then proximal limbs. He denied sexual contact in recent one year. Due to concern for syphilis and scrub typhus infection, he was admitted for oral minocycline and levofloxacin treatment. Results: The patient had thrombocytopenia (94×103/μL) and elevated liver enzyme (AST: 182 IU/L, ALT: 141 IU/L). However, after four days of antibiotics, the patient was still febrile and suffering from headache. Brain CT was not remarkable. Lumbar puncture revealed clear colorless fluid with lymphocyte predominant (71%), total protein was 114.9 mg/dL, and glucose was 61 mg/dL. RPR was non-reactive and specific treponemal antibody test was also negative. In contrast, Orientia Tsutsugamushi IgM and IgG were positive. After seven days of levofloxacin treatment, the ulcer had almost healed. Therefore, the final diagnosis was scrub typhus infection. Conclusion: To our knowledge, an eschar from scrub typhus infection presenting as penile ulcer has never been previously reported. However, painless genital ulcer may mislead clinicians to consider STD at first. As clinicians in an area with high prevalence of scrub typhus, we must recognize the importance of prompt diagnosis and treatment. Background: Relative bradycardia has been reported in many infectious diseases, including dengue fever. Here we report a dengue related sinus bradycardia in a 40-year-old woman.Methods: This 40-year-old female HBV carrier, a second-hand goods business woman, presented to our hospital with chief complaints of fever and chills for 2 days. She lived in Hualien but had been to Kaohsiung for a one-day trip with her husband during a dengue epidemic in 2015. Three days after coming home, she had a sudden onset of fever and chills, accompanied with general soreness, abdominal discomfort, diarrhea, cough, and low back pain. She came to the emergency room. On examination, the temperature was 36.9°C, pulse rate 91 beat/min, respiratory rate 17 breath/min, and blood pressure 126/68 mmHg. Physical examination showed several pruritic and warm erythematous maculopapules with excoriation scattering on her right arm. Laboratory tests revealed thrombocytopenia of 124,000/uL, otherwise normal. Influenza A/B antigen, and initial dengue IgM and IgG were all negative. She complained of persistent low back pain at the emergency room, and was then admitted to the Infectious Disease service for further management. Results: Two days after admission, she had a fever again, and the body temperature was 38°C. Laboratory tests revealed white blood cell count of 1,330/uL, CRP 0.43 mg/dL, and platelet 57,000/uL. Pneumococcus antigen and Mycoplasma pneumoniae IgM were negative. She had chest distress, and bradycardia, ranging from 40 to 60 beat/min, was noted on hospital day 3. Holter monitor showed sinus rhythm with ventricular rate 38 to 104 beat/min (mean: 55 beat/min). One week after admission, blood culture report showed no growth. However, liver dysfunction was noted, with AST and ALT elevated to 109 and 108 IU/L, respectively. Other laboratory tests revealed HBV DNA(Q): 187 IU/mL, HBs Ag (+): 173.10 IU/mL, HBe Ag: negative, HBc IgM: negative. The biphasic fever pattern was consistent with so-called camelback fever pattern. Re-check Dengue NS1 Ag with real-time PCR on hospital day 9 was positive. The patient improved much after supportive care, and the liver function index, fever, and bradycardia were relieved as well. She was discharged uneventfully. Conclusion: Dengue can cause bradycardia, which could be symptomatic but rarely life-threatening, often ignored by most doctors or nurses.

Hospital N, the core of regional medical care, inspected all employees for measles antibodies in 2012 and has since inspected new officials. However, many staff had measles immunization record only one. Secondary vaccine failure (SVF) (initially a suitable response is seen and the immune system decreases over time) is said to occur in a few percent of vaccinated people. Therefore, we investigated whether staff's measles immunity had declined within 5 years. Methods: Since 2012, at the N hospital, measles antibodies tested all officials using the gelatin particle aggregation (PA) assay (test 1). If the PA value was less than 258 (less than measles immunity standard) (LMI), they were able to receive measles rubella (MR) vaccine without cost burden. We previously proved that galectin3 (Gal3) promotes HIV1 NL43 budding through associating with Alix and Gag p6. The purpose of this study isto analyze the potential regulatory function of Gal3 in HIV1 CRF07_BC infections. Methods: HIV1 CRF07_BC infectious clones were constructed, which contains 7 and 11 a.a. deletions (7d and11d) plus a repaired form in the Gag p6 domain. Infectivity assays, replication kinetics, and immunoblotting were used to evaluate the regulating effects of Gal3 on CRF07_BC virus replication and budding. Immunofluorescent staining, super resolution analyses and Membrane flotation were used to measure Gal3 colocalization with Alix or Gag7d and Gag11d and cofractionation patterns. Coimmunoprecipitation(CoIP) assays were used to evaluate interactions between Alix and Gag p6 truncated form in expression or knockdown Gal3 CD4+ T cells. Results: Data from cotransfections of pCRF07_BC and pGal3 vectors into 293T cells indicate that Gal3 expression resulted in a slight increase in CRF07_BC viral budding and slower replication kinetics compared to the NL43 strain. This phenomenon could be compensated when repairing a.a. deletions in the 07_BCp6 domain. Immunofluorescent staining and super resolution analyses indicate Gal3 expression slightly enhanced this colocalization to 30-40%; a significant increase (60-70%) was noted when Alix was colocalized with repaired 07BCGag ( p < 0.01). Membrane flotation data indicate that (a) Alix, Gag7d or11d, and flotinin1 (a lipid raft marker) exhibited reduced cofractionation toward cell membranes, and Gal3 expression slightly increased the cofractionation of these proteins. CoIP data indicate that IP Alix and Gag7d or 11d pulled down smaller amounts of down Gag7d or 11d and Alix respectively, while IP Alix and repaired 07BCGag pulled significantly larger amounts of repaired 07BCGag and Alix in the presence of Gal3 ( p < 0.05). We also detected higher concentrations of Gal3 in sera collected from patients infected with HIV1 subtype B compared to patients infected with CRF07_BC. Tubacin, an HDAC6 selective inhibitor, reduces the replication of Japanese encephalitis virus via the decrease of viral RNA synthesis Chien-Yi Lu, Cheng-Wen Lin*. Department of Medical Laboratory Science and Biotechnology, China Medical University, Taichung 40402, TaiwanBackground: Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV), a neurotropic flavivirus, annually causes over 30,000 JE cases in East and Southeast Asia. Histone deacetylases (HDACs) modulate lysine acetylation of histones and non-histone proteins, regulating many processes including inflammation and antiviral immune response. This study investigated antiviral activity of pan-and selective-HDAC inhibitors as host-targeting agents against JEV. Methods: Antiviral activity of pan-and selective-HDAC inhibitors was evaluated by their inhibitory effect on JEV-induced cytopathic effect (CPE) and apoptosis, virus yields in cultured supernatants, and intracellular virus titers. Antiviral mechanism(s) of HDAC inhibitors was determined using attachment, time-of-addition, and viral RNA synthesis assays. Results: Among HDAC inhibitors, selective HDAC6 inhibitors (tubastatin-A (TBSA) and tubacin) concentration-dependently inhibited JEV-induced cytopathic effect and apoptosis, as well as reduced virus yield in human cerebellar medulloblastoma cells. The 50% inhibitory concentration (IC50) values of virus yield was 0.26 μM for tubacin and 1.75 μM for TBSA, respectively. Tubacin (IC50 of 1.52 μM), but not TBSA, meaningfully blocked the production of intracellular infectious virus particles. In time-ofaddition assays, the greatest potency of antiviral activity was observed in the mode of pre-treatment with tubacin (IC50 of 1.89 μM) compared to simultaneous (IC50 of 4.88 μM) and posttreatment (IC50 of 2.05 μM) modes. Interestingly, tubacin induced the hyperacetylation of a HDAC6 substrate Hsp90 and reduced the interaction of Hsp90 with JEV NS5 protein. Novobiocin, an Hsp90 inhibitor, diminished the NS5 protein amount and virus replication in JEV-infected cells. Meantime, tubacin suppressed the NS5 expression and antisense RNA genome synthesis in infected cells. Tubacin-induced Hsp90 hyperacetylation was suggested to influence the NS5 activity in JEV replication. Conclusion: Tubacin had high potential of a host-targeting agent against JEV, exhibiting preventive and therapeutic activities against JEV infection. Background: Severe dengue is characterized by aberrant immunologic over-activation and cytokine production. Chronic kidney disease was an epidemiologically identified risk factor for development of severe dengue in dengue-affected patients. However, the immunologic responses of patient with chronic kidney disease when suffering from dengue virus (DENV) infection have not been fully understood. Methods: We performed an in vitro study evaluating the sequential immunological reactions in the DENV-2 infected mononuclear cells of patients with end stage renal disease (ESRD) under hemodialysis (n = 34) (ESRD group) and healthy adults (control group) (n = 30). The concentrations of interleukin [IL]-1Ra, IL-6, IL-8, IL-10, IL-12, granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF)、 monocyte chemotactic protein-1 (MCP-1), macrophage inflammatory protein-1b (MIP-1b), vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and tumor necrosis factor-a (TNF-a) in the supernatants from the infected mononuclear cells were measured at 6h, 24h, 48h and 72h, respectively. Results: Among the ESRD participants, hypertension (61.7%) was the most common comorbidity, followed by diabetes mellitus (41.2%). At 6h after DENV-2 infection, the concentration of GM-CSF in ESRD group was significantly higher than that in the control group. However, the ESRD group had significantly lower GM-CSF、 IL-1Ra, IL-6, TNF-a, VEGF and IL-12p70 levels than those of the control group at 48 h after DENV-2 infection. In addition, significantly lower levels of IL-8, IL-10, IL-12p40, MCP-1 and MIP-1b were detected in the ESRD group compared to control group at 6h, 24h, 48h and 72h, respectively, after DENV-2 infection. Conclusion: The role of chemo-cytokines in the subsequent development of severe dengue in ESRD patients remains uncertain.

High human herpesvirus type 8 seroprevalence already present in patients with chronic hepatitis stage before the development of cirrhosis Cheng-Chuan Su 1,2 *, Kuo-Chih Tseng 1,3 , Ming-Nan Lin 1,4 , Jen-Pi Tsai 1, 3, 5 Background: A high seroprevalence of HHV-8 in patients with mild cirrhosis is significantly associated with hepatitis activity. Cirrhosis is almost derived from chronic hepatitis. However, the status of HHV-8 infection in patients with chronic hepatitis remains unclear. Methods: Blood samples from 129 patients with chronic hepatitis and from 129 age-matched healthy controls were collected and analyzed for monocyte and platelet counts, hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), anti-hepatitis C virus (anti-HCV), HHV-8 antibody and DNA, and alanine aminotransferase (ALT). Results: Mean monocyte and platelet counts were significantly higher and lower in patients with chronic hepatitis than in healthy controls (P = 0.021 and <0.0001, respectively). Seropositive rate for HHV-8 antibodies was significantly greater in patients (32.6%) than in controls (20.9%, P = 0.035), particularly in patients with HCV infection, or higher plasma ALT levels, or both (P = 0.004, 0.011, and 0.0009, respectively). The mean age of HHV-8 seropositive patients (60.3 years) was significantly older than that of seronegative patients (52.3 years) (P = 0.0009). Antibody titers for HHV-8 in patients also exceeded those in controls (P = 0.018). Conclusion: A significantly high HHV-8 seroprevalence is already present in patients with chronic hepatitis before the development of cirrhosis, particularly in patients with HCV infection, or higher plasma ALT levels, or both. Owing to the acute retroviral syndrome with negative results of HIV infection and suspected malignant lymphoma, we considered the possibility of acute HTLV-1 infection. The antiviral activity of Perilla frutescens against enterovirus 71 in rhabdomyosarcoma cells after ultra-performance liquid chromatography separation Win-Jei Hwang 1 , Hao-Wen Shih 1 , Ren-Hung Chang 1 , Yung-Fu Wang 2 , Chi-Ho Chan 3 *. Background: Enterovirus type 71 (EV71) causes many diseases ranging from mild to severe neurological symptoms. Unfortunately, there is still no effective medicine against EV71 for clinical use. In previous study, hot crude extract of Perilla frutescens possess anti-EV71 activity. In this study, we tried to assay the cytotoxicity and anti-viral actitivity of different fractions of P. frutescens. Methods: In order to confirm which compound(s) with antiviral activity against EV71, separation of the crude extract by ultraperformance liquid chromatography (UPLC) with fraction collector was carried out. After antiviral activity test, the expected components in the fraction extract were analyzed by UPLC-Q/TOF to identify the exact molecular weight for further chemical formula search. Results: Due to complex mixture of hot crude extract of Perilla frutescens, it is difficult to gain the useful information of compound (s) with antiviral activity against EV71. The related experiments are in progress. Conclusion: With the separation method and identification proceed by UPLC and Q/TOF, it is facilitate to study the mechanism of antiviral activity against EV71 in future.

Background: Human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) UL76 protein and its related protein family UL24_Herpes target to nucleolus at the late phase of viral infection. In several animal modeling systems for herpesvirus infection, it is demonstrated that members of UL24_Herpes are the pathogenic determinants which exacerbate disease progression by enhancing the efficiency of viral reactivation from latency. We demonstrated that UL76 interacts with subunits of ubiquitin-proteasome system, resulting in the sequestration of polyubiquitinated proteins and the relocation of proteasome subunits into nucleolus. We hypothesized that UL76 interacts with nucleolar proteins and modulates the ultrastructure of nucleolus. Methods: The interactions of UL76 and nucleolar proteins were assessed by the following experiments: immunocoprecipitation assay, immunofluorescence cell staining and imaging techniques, and fluorescence resonance energy transfer assay. These experiments were performed both in the HCMV-infected cells and in the transient expression of DNA co-transfected cell system. Fluorescence recovery after photobleaching assay was performed to assess the nucleolar protein kinetic profiles in the presence of UL76. Results: Several lines of evidence consistently support that UL76 interacts with nucleolar major nucleolar protein NPM1. UL76 and NPM1 are in a protein complex. UL76 localizes in close proximity with NPM1 protein. UL76 affects the diffusion kinetics of NPM1. Conclusion: Our results elucidate a common and fundamental mechanism that UL76, likely UL24_herpes protein family, modulates nucleolar ultrastructure.

back_matter.text: The effects of bundle care on ventilator-associated pneumonia prevention in a regional hospital Wen-yin Huang 1 *, Wen-chen Yao 1 , Shu-chien Liang 2 , Lo-chen Hu 2 , Yu-mei Ho 3 . 1 Nursing Department, 2 Intensive care unit, 3

Background: This study aimed to understand the effects of bundle care (daily assessment for extubation and sedative discontinuance, administration of 0.12-0.2% chlorhexidine for oral care, head elevation of 30-45°and removal of ventilator circuit water retention) on ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP) prevention. Methods: This study used retrospective methods to collect medical records for data analysis. The target population was patients with ventilators using endotracheal tubes or tracheostomy within bundle care at an intensive care unit in a regional hospital between April, 2015 and September, 2016. Results: There were total of 242 patients with ventilators using endotracheal tubes or tracheostomy at an intensive care unit in a regional hospital between April, 2015 and September, 2016. Male patients accounted for 62.4% while patients with age 65 or above accounted for 61.2%. The medium administration period was 4 days (1∼61 days). The infection size was 2 persons while total ventilator user-days were 2418 person-days. As a result, the average VAP infection rate was 0.78‰. Conclusion: After introducing bundle care for VAP prevention in 2015, the VAP infection rate between April, 2015 and September, 2016 was 0.78‰, which was lower than the average rate (1.22‰) of other hospitals with the same Taiwan Clinical Performance Indicator. The introduction of bundle care was successful under the full supports of the management and the full participation of the entire team. Results: Within the whole population, the leading pathogens associated with CLABSIs were gram-negative bacteria (GNB, 59.3%), followed by gram-positive bacteria (24.8%), and fungi (23.4%). Acinetobacter spp, Enterobacter spp, and Stenotrophomonas maltophilia were the most frequently isolated. There was an increase of Vancomycin-resistant strain (all were Enterococcus faecium), which was of statistically significance ( p = 0.028), but no significant time trend identified in methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (3.5% vs 2.3%, p = 0.553), carbapenem-resistant Acinetobacter baumannii (CRAB) (7.1% vs 5.0%, p = 0.506), and carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa (CRPA) (1.8% vs 1.6%, p = 1.000). Markedly reduced episodes of mixed infection (12.4% vs. 5.0%, p = 0.010) was noticed post bundle implementation. Via univariate analysis, patients those had older age (≥65 years old), cardiovascular disease, renal disease, malignancy, ICU admission mainly for respiratory disease or sepsis, catheter placement in internal jugular vein, inadequate empirical antimicrobial therapy, infected by fungi, or resistant strains were more likely to expire within 14 days (all p < 0.05). In multivariate analysis, malignancy, inadequate empirical antimicrobial therapy, inadequate definite antimicrobial therapy, and infection by fungi or multidrug-resistant organisms (MDROs) were associated with 14-day mortality (all p < 0.05, table 1). The CLABSI incidence rate decreased from 5.54 to 2.18 per 1,000 catheter-day (from 2014 to 2015) which disclosed the effectiveness of insertion and maintenance bundles, and the importance of its compliance (figure 1). Conclusion: We identified Gram-negative bacteria as leading pathogens of CLABSIs in a Taiwan medical center. Malignancy, infection by MDROs or fungi, inadequate empirical or definite antimicrobial therapy are significant factors for 14-day mortality. Among monitored items of the care bundle, the complicance of maximal sterile barrier precaution (54.6% to 74.6%) during catheter insertion could be a key componenet. It indicated the compliance investigation is necessary to find out the specific defecit during the intervention period.

Effects of combined care on urinary tract infection associated with catheters Shu-Chien Liang 1 *, Wen-Chen Yao 2 , Yen-Ju Huang 1 , Yu-Mei Ho 3 , Wen-Yin Huang 2 . 1 Intensive care unit, 2 Department of Nursing, 3

Background: Medical team efforts to avoid iatrogenic damage, especially catheter-related urinary tract infection (CAUTI) is the most common medical care-related infection, so it is important to reduce the incidence of CAUTI in the hospital. The intensive care unit (ICU) of a regional teaching hospital in North Taiwan, statistics the average density of CAUTI from January to December 2014 was 3.47 ‰. In order to reduce iatrogenic injury and reduce medical expenses, the implementation of bundle care was performed to reduce the occurrence of infection. Methods: Through the database literature verification, search CAUTI prevention guidelines, through the group on the decisionmaking, interventional care measures. The intervention period is from January to December 2015, which includes education and training to prevent CAUTI proper care, DOPS clinical technology learning, and equipment improvement, the establishment of bundle care, included: compliance with hand hygiene, maintenance of the urinary tract system aseptic, keep catheter and collecting tube free from kinking, Urinary drainage bags kept below level of bladder and can not be rest bag on floor, empty collecting bag regularly using a separate, clean container for each patient, ensure drainagespigot does not contact nonsterile container, protocols for nurse-directed removal of Unnecessary catheters).And make slogans and tips to remind. Results: The study results revealed that the patients in the experimental group significantly reduced the CAUTI. The average density of CAUTI in 2014 was 3.47 ‰ (n = 2814), and the average density decreased by 1.15 ± 0.04 ‰ (n = 2601) in 2015 after interventional bundle care. The accuracy of care techniques for CAUTI prevention were significantly increased from 60.1% to 93.95 ± 0.64%. The staff confidence rate in KAP for CAUTI prevention were significantly increased from 62.80% to 97.5± 0.54%, and the use of indwelling catheter decreased from 73.76% to 71.01%. During the implementation period in 2015, six cases occurred in June and July, due to high severity of the disease, and Insert catheters were in the emergency room, the teams discussed to replace the catheter as soon as possible. Continued bundle care and tracking, 2016 CAUTI has reached zero tolerance (0‰; n = 2737), and reduced the indwelling catheter utilization to 69.35%. Conclusion: The results of our study provide Preventing CAUTI information for improving the quality. The establishment of a consistent clinical care process, improve the equipment, develop monitoring mechanisms, and design slogan (hand hygiene, antiseptic, catheter, un-kinking, removal) , so that nurses easy to remember, to promote cognitive and the accuracy techniques of indwelling catheter care. We suggested this study provide appropriate bundle care intervention to promote the hospital to implement infection control, improve the quality of medical care and patient safety.

Methods: A total of 1897 non-duplicated nosocomial cases as well as pathogens causing bloodstream infections (BSI), hospitalacquired pneumonia (HAP) and intra-abdominal infections (IAI) from 12 teaching hospital around China were collected. Comparative proteomics-based identification of proteins associated with the bacterial death in vancomycin-susceptible enterococci treated with vancomycin Shiao-Ping Huang 1 *, Hsin-Feng Yeh 1 , Li-Feng Bu 2 , Huey-Ling You 2 . Background: To understand the possibility of that the MALDI-TOF MS applied on the vancomycin susceptibility detection of enterococci, this study performed the proteomics analysis for detecting the changes of proteins during the bacterial death of enterococci. Methods: The vancomycin-susceptible Enterococcus faecalis was treated either with or without vancomycin (6 ug/ml) for 1 hour. The bacterial death was confirmed with colony count and LIVE/ DEAD dual fluorescent stain. Then the whole bacterial proteins were extracted and separated with two-dimension-polyacrylamide-gel-electrophoresis (2D-PAGE) and then the changes of proteins were analyzed. The interested changes in the protein spots were picked and subjected to perform the LC-MS/MS for examining the protein spots. Results: The result shown in colony count and dual fluorescent stain indicated that the Enterococcus faecalis treated with vancomycin for 1 hour caused bacterial death. Therefore, the proteins collected in the process of bacterial death were examined at 1 hour. Nine identified proteins were observed to be increase during the process of bacterial death. They were triggger factor, phenylalanine-tRNA ligase alpha subunit, 30S ribosomal protein S2, DnaK, 50S ribosomal protein L2, 50S ribosomal protein L1, uracil phosphoribosyl transferase, 30S ribosomal protein S4, and 50S ribosomal protein L10, respectivly. Conclusion: The vancomycin caused bacterial death in Enterococcus faecalis has been detected at 1 hour. The proteins induced during the bacterial death have been analyzed and 9 identified proteins could be applied as the protein markers during the bacterial death. This finding is contributed to help us in the early differentiation of vancomycin-resistant enterococci and vancomycin-susceptible enterococci.

Encephalitis and status epilepticus in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus combined with neurological manifestation Yeh chiu-yin. Chi Mei Medical Center, Intensive Care Medicine, Yongkang, TaiwanIntroduction: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) affect multiple organ systems. Brain involvement commonly causes seizures, central nervous systemic (CNS) lupus may occur without systemic SLE activity, often leading to a delayed diagnosis. We discuss the case of SLE and presenting with an atypical movement disorder and partial continuous epilepsy. Case Reports: The 37 years old male patient with the past history paroxysms of altered consciousness with stupor, reduced awareness and poor responses nearly one hour and over eight times within half year suspect seizure was regular followed up at our neurological department. This time, he suffered from fever up to 39 degree, altered metal status and falling down episode and seizure was told at that time. He became stupor, general weakness and consciousness change. After admission, intravenous ceftriaxone was used for suspicious of meningitis. Brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) revealed suspicious of CNS lupus, electroencephalography (EEG) and lumbar puncture were done. Solu-medrol for pulse therapy was performed. However, progressive lower limbs weakness was noted. Then, cervical to thoracic spine MRI was done and C2-C6 spine cord edema was noted. So Cyclophosphamide was administered and steroid was kept for further treatment. Due to CNS infection couldn't be ruled out, we maintain antibiotics with ceftriaxone for ten days. However due to progressive weakness, and deteriorated consciousness, Double filtration plasmapheresis was performed and after treatment, his conscious and muscle power were improving and could answer simple questions. He was discharged and rheumatology OPD follow up was arranged. Discussion: Seizures often complicate systemic autoimmune disorders through a variety of mechanisms. Understanding the pathophysiology of epileptogenesis in these patients may help provide therapeutic targets for specific patients. Also, MRI and laboratory findings, including CSF analysis are rarely specific. Only a combination of several diagnostic procedures, additional specific serological tests, and, if possible, stereotactic brain biopsy may ensure a firm diagnosis.

Tamarixetin exerts anti-inflammatory activity and prevents bacterial sepsis by increasing IL-10 production Su Jin Lee, Seung Jun Lee, Yeong-Min Park, In Duk Jung. Department of Immunology, Lab of Dendritic Cell Differentiation & Regulation, School of Medicine, Konkuk University, Chungju, 380-701, South Korea Background: Sepsis causes systemic inflammatory response due to pathogenic infection. Currently, sepsis treatment depends on antibiotics without specific drugs. Dysregulated host immune defense system against pathogenic infection might be a major cause of sepsis. Therefore, not only therapeutic agents but also prevention strategies that can strengthen the host immune defense system are needed for sepsis. Tamarixetin (4'-O-methylated quercetin) is a flavonoid derivative with anti-inflammatory properties against Lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-mediated inflammation. The purpose of this study was to determine the antiinflammatory effect of Tamarixetin on inflammatory conditions induced by LPS or Escherichia coli K1. Methods: Dendritic cells (DCs) were pretreated with Tamarixetin followed by LPS or E. coli stimulation. Female Balb/c mice were intraperitoneally (i.p.) injected with tamarixetin 1 hr before injecting LPS or E. coli K1. Serum and tissues were collected for further experiments. Results: Tamarixetin reduced the secretion of inflammatory cytokines but further increased the secretion of anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-10 in DCs induced by LPS. In addition, tamarixetin showed excellent anti-inflammatory effect on bacterial sepsis through eliminating bacteria and endotoxin. Moreover, tamarixetin further increased the population of immune cells secreting IL-10 in splenocytes of mice induced by LPS. Conclusion: Tamarixetin has anti-inflammatory effect superior to quercetin in bacterial sepsis mouse model. Its effect is associated with increased IL-10-secreting immune cells. Therefore, Tamarixetin could be used to prevent bacterial sepsis.PS 560 HCV incidence among HIV-positive MSM in Taiwan during an outbreak of acute HCV Shu-Yuan Ho 1 , Pi-Han Lin 3 , Li-Hsin Su 2 , Yi-Ching Su 2 , Chien-Ching Hung 2 , Sui-yuan Chang 1,3 . 1 Departments of Laboratory Medicine, National Taiwan University Hospital, 2 Departments of Internal Medicine, National Taiwan University Hospital, 3 Department of Clinical Laboratory Sciences and Medical Biotechnology, National Taiwan University Background: Outbreaks of sexually transmitted hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection have been recently reported in HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM) in Taiwan since March 2015. We aimed to know the prevalence and incidence of hepatitis C virus (HCV), which shares the same transmission route as HCV, among HIV-infected MSM receiving clinical care at National Taiwan University Hospital (NTUH). Methods: During 2016-2017, a retrospective observational cohort study was performed to assess the incidence of recent HCV seroconversion among 2,337 HIV-infected MSM at the National Taiwan University Hospital using anti-HCV IgG kit (Mikrogen Diagnostik, Neureid, Germany). The seropositive specimens were further confirmed by anti-HCV western blot kit (Mikrogen Diagnostik, Neureid, Germany). When negative, a PCR with primers covering the NS5B region was conducted. The same PCR was used to amplify HCV sequences from seroconverters, and the HCV genotype was determined by phylogenetic analysis. Results: A total of 39 specimens (39/ 2337, 1.67%) were seropositive by anti-HCV IgG ELISA. Among the ELISA positive specimens, 9 and 39 were confirmed of HCV infection by anti-HCV western blot and HCV PCR, respectively. During a total follow-up duration of 2290 person-years of follow-up (PYFU), 30 patients had HCV seroconversion with an overall incidence rate of 16.9 per 1,000 PYFU, which is similar to the HCV incidence we observed in 2015 (16.8 per 1,000 PYFU). Of the 39 HCV seroconverters, 30 had HCV viremia and HCV sequences were successfully amplified from 30 patients. Phylogenetic analysis was conducted: 16 are genotype 2a (53.3%), 7 genotype 6a (23.3%), 4 genotype 1b (13.3%), 1 genotype 1a (3.3%), 1 genotype 3a(3.3%), and1 genotype 6n(3.3%). Three HCV transmission clusters were identified, belonging to genotype 1b, 2a, and 6a, respectively. No Sofosbuvir resistance-associated mutation S282T was identified in study subjects. Conclusions: During the outbreak of acute hepatitis C among MSM in Taiwan, the prevalence and incidence rate of HCV infection remains stable. Surveillance of HCV infection is warranted for the high-risk populations.
